result.translation: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1],
result.footnotes: [1] Allah had given Quraysh the honor of being guardians of the Holy Ka‘bah, which allowed them to travel in peace without fear of being harmed.

result.translation: secure in their winter and summer journeys[2].
result.footnotes: [2] i.e., their trading caravans would travel south to Yemen in winter and north to the Levant in summer.

result.translation: Let them worship the Lord of this [Sacred] House[3],

result.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ
result.translation: Who fed them against hunger and made them secure against fear[4].
result.footnotes: [4] The people of Quraysh were blessed with provision and security probably because of the prayer of Abraham. See 14:35-37
